page.title: 03FARMING TOFTWOOD WESTFIELD
page.content: Within our 12 kilometer grid, 9 of the squares were categorized as farmland. We carried out a survey of the farms in our area. There are 10 working farms in the area and 9 of these took part in our survey. The average size of a farm in this area is 235 acres. 8 of the farms are family owned and only one was tenanted. Virtually all the work on the farms was done by members of the family and great use was made of machinery. Between them, the farms owned 18 tractors and 11 combine harvesters and a wide variety of other machinery and they worked on average 10 hours a day. 70% of the land was used for growing crops such as barley, wheat, rape and sugar beet. The remainder of the land was used for producing fodder or as pasture.
